Hear ye this, O priests; and hearken, ye house of Israel; and give ye ear, O house of the king; for judgment <FI>is<Fi> toward you, because ye have been a snare on Mizpah, and a net spread upon Tabor.
And the revolters are profound to make slaughter, though I <FI>have been<Fi> a rebuker of them all.<RF>though: or, and<Rf><RF>a rebuker: Heb. a correction<Rf>
I know Ephraim, and Israel is not hid from me: for now, O Ephraim, thou committest whoredom, <FI>and<Fi> Israel is defiled.

They will not frame their doings to turn unto their God: for the spirit of whoredoms <FI>is<Fi> in the midst of them, and they have not known the LORD.<RF>They will…: or, Their doings will not suffer them<Rf><RF>frame: Heb. give<Rf>
And the pride of Israel doth testify to his face: therefore shall Israel and Ephraim fall in their iniquity; Judah also shall fall with them.
They shall go with their flocks and with their herds to seek the LORD; but they shall not find <FI>him<Fi>; he hath withdrawn himself from them.
They have dealt treacherously against the LORD: for they have begotten strange children: now shall a month devour them with their portions.<CM>
Blow ye the cornet in Gibeah, <FI>and<Fi> the trumpet in Ramah: cry aloud <FI>at<Fi> Bethaven, after thee, O Benjamin.
Ephraim shall be desolate in the day of rebuke: among the tribes of Israel have I made known that which shall surely be.
The princes of Judah were like them that remove the bound: <FI>therefore<Fi> I will pour out my wrath upon them like water.
Ephraim <FI>is<Fi> oppressed <FI>and<Fi> broken in judgment, because he willingly walked after the commandment.
Therefore <FI>will<Fi> I <FI>be<Fi> unto Ephraim as a moth, and to the house of Judah as rottenness.<RF>rottenness: or, a worm<Rf>

When Ephraim saw his sickness, and Judah <FI>saw<Fi> his wound, then went Ephraim to the Assyrian, and sent to king Jareb: yet could he not heal you, nor cure you of your wound.<RF>king Jareb: or, the king of Jareb: or, the king that should plead<Rf>
For I <FI>will be<Fi> unto Ephraim as a lion, and as a young lion to the house of Judah: I, <FI>even<Fi> I, will tear and go away; I will take away, and none shall rescue <FI>him<Fi>.
I will go <FI>and<Fi> return to my place, till they acknowledge their offence, and seek my face: in their affliction they will seek me early.<RF>acknowledge…: Heb. be guilty<Rf><CM>
